question: List mediators that are released from mast cells?
ideal_answer:
tryptase
histamine
heparin proteoglycan
chymase
cytokines
2,3-dinor-11β-PGF2α
leukotriene (LT)E4

snippets.text: Once mast cells are activated, beta-tryptase is released along with histamine and heparin proteoglycan.

Degranulation of mast cells (MCs) releases several mediators such as vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), chymase, tryptase, histamine, and cytokines, which all have important roles in the severity of dengue infection.
Mediators included serum tryptase plus urinary N-methyl histamine (N-MH), leukotriene (LT)E4, and 11β-prostaglandin (PG) F2α or 2,3-dinor-11β-PGF2α (BPG)

exact_answer: tryptase, histamine, heparin proteoglycan, chymase, cytokines, 2,3-dinor-11β-PGF2α, leukotriene (LT)E4
